div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
color: rgb(255, 255, 255) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: Correctness — Is the information factually accurate?

div.style: color: rgb(255, 255, 255) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: Relevance — Does it answer the actual question?

div.style: color: rgb(255, 255, 255) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: Coherence — Is it logically structured and readable?

div.style: color: rgb(255, 255, 255) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: Helpfulness — Does it actually help the user?

div.style: color: rgb(255, 255, 255) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: Safety — Is it free from harmful content?

div.style: color: rgb(255, 255, 255) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: Consistency — Does it align with other responses?
